name: dariiALT
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))
-| wi(wa(w0, w2), wa(w0, w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))
-| wi(wa(w0, w2), wa(w0, w1))

|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))
-| wi(w2, w1)

|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w1))

comment: Alternate proof of ~ darii , shorter but using more axioms. This shows how the use of ~ spi may shorten some proofs of the Aristotelian syllogisms, even though this adds axiom dependencies. Note that ~ spi is the inference associated with ~ sp , which corresponds to the axiom (T) of modal logic. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 27-Aug-2016.) Added precisions on axiom usage. (Revised by BJ, 27-Sep-2022.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
